text: I've done several solo trips in my eight
years of traveling the world and I know
that solo travel can be a bit daunting
there are a lot of unknowns and without
anyone there to help you you're stuck
relying on yourself to manage and handle
everything so here are eight ways to
break down your fear of solo travel all
trouble especially solo travel is a lot
of problem-solving everything you do can
be broken up into small problems which
you'll then need to solve the more
problems you solve the better you get at
solving them
the key is trusting your abilities to
naturally solve these travel related
problems most of them are the same
problems you'd solve at home and when
you take it step by step it's much
easier think about it like this how
would you find a combination and places
to eat or things to do in your hometown
Google well the same thing as a work
abroad it's the same skill set just in a
different location determine your
comfort zone it's okay not to know right
away as there is no right or wrong way
to travel
traveling solo doesn't mean you have to
travel solo the whole trip you can
easily mix it up and add an organized
tour group here or there to accompany
your travels you can choose to do public
transit or just take a cab don't push
yourself beyond your limits and figure
out what is and isn't in your comfort
zone when I first started solo travel it
was in New Zealand I was so nervous the
same day I arrived I booked a huge
hop-on hop-off tour bus it allowed me to
travel around the country via a safe bus
network and to hop off into places that
I wish to spend more time in and that
helped ease me into solo travel it also
allowed me to stay longer in places by
myself in hindsight I wish I didn't book
as big of a tour right away and I gave
myself a bit more time to adjust because
I just wasn't feeling comfortable on the
tourist trail not necessarily the most
touristy places the places that have a
lot of information and infrastructure
when you are starting out this means
it's easy to get around and to figure
out where to go you won't get lonely
making friends is very very easy once
you are on the road when you were pushed
out of your comfort zone it forces you
to reach out to people for help for
questions and just for general
socialization you have to open up you
need to learn to be the instigator the
person starting up the conversation even
if it's just a simplest thing hi I'm
Nadine what's your name - the person
next to you when I was at the airport
trying to figure out how do I get to my
hostel I notice a few other backpackers
trying to do the same so I went up to
them and I asked them where they were
going if they were heading into town and
if they wanted to share a ride better
yet they knew of the public bus which
was a dollar 30 instead of the $30 that
the taxis were trying to charge me so I
asked if I could follow along and we all
found to stop together and lo and behold
our hostels were right beside each other
it worked out great learning to put
yourself out there and to talk to people
is such a valuable skill you will learn
to master the more you travel solo act
confident and like you know what you are
doing then scammers are less likely to
bother you walk with purpose and try to
blend in as much as possible this is the
time to be extra inconspicuous with your
clothing and jewelry you're trying to
not stand out as much as you can start
small if you've never traveled by
yourself and are considering a lengthy
solo trip start by doing a small trip
first this helps calm anxious friends
and family members and it helps you gain
more confidence in your skills as a solo
traveler think of it like learning to
swim you don't just jump off the deep
end you start in the kiddie pool with
water wings and you learn how to swim
you practice and then you work your way
out to the deep end with your swimming
abilities always have a working phone if
you are traveling with someone else this
isn't as important but if you are alone
is make sure that you can call someone
if you are lost or if you need help this
is like safety 101 we live in the age of
cellular technology
it's 2018 everybody has a phone take
advantage of it plus when you are
connected on your phone it is the source
of so much of knowledge it's basically
your own digital best friend it can
provide you with any kind of resource
you can imagine so love your phone when
you are solo traveling always trust your
gut it's surprisingly good and knowing
when you should or shouldn't do
something let's listen to your gut
unless of course it's after a big meal
in which case it's probably just a
little bit of indigestion travel solo
when ready only travel alone if you feel
you are ready it's normal to be nervous
and scared but if you are so worried
scared and nervous that you are making
yourself ill or if it's causing you a
ton of stress then maybe this time isn't
right for you practice makes perfect and
by starting small you can build up that
confidence and you can and you will
become a great solo traveler I hope you
guys enjoyed this video if you did hit
that like button and let me know down
below in the comments if you've ever
done any solo trips before and what did
you find helped you get over the fear of
it if you aren't subscribed to me
already make sure you hit that subscribe
button and turn on your notifications so
that you don't miss out on any of my
